p: For HIV, subtype A gag and env sequences from Los Alamos HIV Sequence Database ( http://www.hiv.lanl.gov) were downloaded. Available sequences from 13 FSU countries, namely, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Estonia, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Latvia, Lithuania, Moldova, Russia, Ukraine, and Uzbekistan, were retrieved (Supplementary Figure 1). Recombinant and duplicate sequences were identified using, respectively, Recombinant HIV-1 Drawing Tool v2.1.0 and ElimDupes ( http://www.hiv.lanl.gov), and eliminated. After alignment and trimming, 371 bp long, 334 gag sequences (HXB2: 859–1230 nt), and 257 bp long, 1282 env sequences (HXB2: 7071–7336 nt) were used for this analysis. To root the tree, 12 reference sequences of nonsubtype A and group M were used from Los Alamos HIV Sequence Database ( http://www.hiv.lanl.gov). To construct the tree with risk group information, data from the HIV Los Alamos database were used.
